alert.note: Alert for Susquehanna; Wyoming (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 18 at 12:47AM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Susquehanna and Wyoming Counties through 115 AM EDT... At 1247 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Rush to near Meshoppen to Kasson Brook. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Vernon, Tunkhannock, Springville, Montrose, Dimock, Hallstead, Noxen, Mehoopany, New Milford and Nicholson. This includes the following highway exits... Pennsylvania Interstate 81 between 223 and 230. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Heavy rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
